job_description: Co-op, Hardware Engineering (4 Month Term)NSERC Eligibility is REQUIRED for this application.  To be NSERC eligible, you must:Be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident of Canada;Be a Full-time student at the time of application;have a CGPA of 2.7 or higher;be an Undergraduate student; andyou have not held an NSERC award within the current fiscal year (April 1 to March 31)Company DescriptionDelta-Q Technologies develops and supplies battery chargers to original equipment manufacturers(OEMs) of electric vehicles and industrial equipment. Delta-Q’s unique blend of engineering capability inhigh efficiency power electronics and embedded software design delivers innovative battery chargingsolutions to meet the evolving needs of its customers. With nearly a million vehicles and industrialmachines already using its products, Delta-Q’s innovation is enabling the widespread adoption ofenvironmentally friendly electric drive systems. Delta-Q was founded in 1999 and is a privately heldcompany located in Vancouver, Canada. Find out more about our company on www.Delta-Q.com.LocationYou will be working out of our head office in Burnaby, BC, right across the street from the BCIT campus.We are nearby transit and close to many malls, restaurants, parks and trails. We offer free parking andhave onsite fitness facilities available to all employees.ReportingYou will be reporting to an experienced Power Electronics Engineer who has been working in theindustry for 10 years. This individual started his career as a co-op student and knows what it takes to bea great support and mentor for you.What We Offer You• The opportunity to learn new technological concepts that support vehicle electrification includingswitch-mode power electronics for power devices and their characteristics, topologies, thermalmanagement, power control and safety/electro-magnetic control (EMC)• A friendly and supportive learning environment promoting innovative thinking and creativity• An environment where teamwork, dedication and having fun are highly valued• Competitive compensation• Professional development and career advancement opportunitiesPosition SummaryIn this position, you will participate in the development of state of the art power electronics products forelectric and hybrid vehicles and for volume production.You will participate in and gain exposure to:• Hardware design activities including: digital and analog electronics, power electronics circuitsimulations, component selection, schematic capture and PCB layouts, to support new productdevelopments and updates to existing products• Prototyping and test plan development such as constructing prototypes, jigs, fixtures andexperiments to meet quality and reliability objectives. You will perform accelerated life testing withvibe, humidity and temperature chambers and utilize a variety of equipment including oscilloscopes,frequency response analyzers, spectrum analyzers and DAQ• Reporting and reviewing the designs and documentation from other engineers including red-linedrawings, reports and other design documentation in order to capture test and prototype results• Other duties in support of engineering objectives as requiredFor more information about Delta-Q Technologies and current career opportunities please visit us atwww.delta-q.com
job_requirements: Requirements• A fourth year student enrolled in a Bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering or a related disciplineis preferred• Applicants must be NSERC eligible• Previous co-op or work experience is an asset• Excellent time management skills with the ability to multi-task to meet deadlines• A strong technical aptitude with the ability to learn new technology• Introductory knowledge, exposure to, and/or interest in, the following areas either through study orpractical experience are highly beneficial:Power electronics topologies, power components, drive circuits, magnetics and protectionThermal management requirements and electro-mechanical integration including PCB layout for high power and high switching frequencyHardware/software integration and debugging, feedback/PWM control, control loop stability, EMC and regulatory requirementsOffice and design software including CAD / simulation tools and creation of reports, drawings, schematics and spreadsheetsOpen To All Majors:No
